Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It's fairly basic but very nice and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The #2 Tram stops only a couple of blocks away. The bed was very cozy and the only problem was that the heating system didn't keep the room quite warm enough. When we inquired about this at the front desk they immediately brought up a portable electric heater and that solved the problem. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but more than adequate and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gritty75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Central Park while on a week-long trip to Amsterdam from the US. We are frequent international travelers and found that while this hotel was very basic, it more than met our needs and was a great deal for the money. We will definitely stay here again the next time we're in Amsterdam, as it gave us a great location in which to be based. We were able to see all the usual attractions, but also got somewhat of a taste of being a local. Hotel Central Park is tucked into a small upscale residential area next to the far end (away from Centraal Station) of the Vondelpark. In late March/early April, we were not able to see the park in all its glory, but bulb flowers were in bloom and trees were beginning to leaf out, and many walkers, runners, and bikers were using the park. During the summer, the hotel's proximity would be an even bigger positive. And don't be misled by the "residential area" of the hotel - this means peace and quiet but it is still a two-minute walk from two major streets, neighborhood restaurants, cafes, shops, and a small Albert Heijn supermarket (great if you choose to save some money by buying some of your food at the grocery store.) As we travelled on a transatlantic flight, we arrived in Amsterdam in early morning and got to the hotel around 8 am, very tired, and well before the usual check-in time. Unfortunately they did not have a room for us yet, but we dropped off our luggage and then were finally able to check-in at noon (6 am our time, after no sleep.) This was still before the usual check-in time, and being unable to check-in and having to wander the city like a zombie is pretty much par for the course after an overnight flight, even at some of the largest hotels. We were fortunate to be so close to the park, a good place to relax (as long as there is no rain.) If you are able-bodied and love walking, you can walk to pretty much anywhere in central Amsterdam from this hotel. I recommend walking to the major museums, as they are just a short walk from the other end of Vondelpark. However, if you plan to do a lot of sight-seeing, walking all day every day can take a lot out of you. This hotel is just a few minutes from the stop for Tram 2, which is a very central line, taking you all the way to Centraal Station, as well as other to major spots like Dam Square, Spui, Leidesplein, Koningsplein, and Museumplein. We arrived in Amsterdam at Schiphol Airport, took the very easy train from Schiphol to Centraal Station, and then took Tram 2 to the hotel. No problem, and not confusing. The tram is easy to use and very efficient. With the new OV-chipkaart payment system, it's even easier to use. Just note that Tram 2 from Centraal Station stops on one side of Amstelveenseweg, and the return tram stops on the other side of the intersection, and on the other side of the cross street (meaning, at a diagonal across the busy Amstelveenseweg.) This is no big deal but you can be confused until you figure it out. The room itself was small - if you're used to paying $100 a night and getting a huge American-style hotel room in minor American cities, the size might come as a shock. But, it's pretty much what you get for a similarly-priced room in New York City. The room is not that much bigger than the bed, and the bathroom is small, but it was fine for two people. Just note that the bathroom is REALLY small and in a double room it is pretty much right next to the bed. Every little sound right down to taking toilet paper, or rustling a plastic bag can be heard through the door. The bathroom also has no fan although it does have some sort of ventilation system. This was all no big deal since I was traveling with my husband, but for two people who don't know each other very well, this could be uncomfortable. The room was not equipped with a refrigerator or microwave, but it does come with an electric hotwater kettle and some instant coffee and tea bags. I bought my own box of teabags at Albert Heijn and some breakfast foods and had a great breakfast in-room each morning (convenient and much cheaper than what the hotel was charging.) The window in our room was an old-style floor-to-ceiling set of French doors, and while we did not have a full balcony, the doors were operational and there was about a foot of space where you could stand (and a protective iron gate to keep you from falling out.) This made the room seem larger. We were at the front of the hotel so our view was of the residences across the street, but some of the rooms have a park view. The bed as also incredibly comfortable as other reviewers have noted. One great perk - the hotel now rents bikes! They have a rack right in front of the building. Rates seemed just slightly more than what we would pay elsewhere, but the convenience couldn't be beaten. And, these bikes were much more understated in appearance than is the case with Mac Bikes or Yellow Bikes, or most of the other rental bikes in the city which scream "tourist." The bikes are white and do have a sticker with the hotel name (the new logo as seen on their website) but it is not highly visible. We rented bikes for 48 hours and found it a joy to ride in such a bike-friendly city. We left the hotel by bike and almost immediately entered the Vondelpark, which acts as a major bike thoroughfare, but is also big enough that you can do a lot of recreational biking just in a the park. We rode all over the city and were able to see areas we wouldn't have seen on foot or via tram. We found the Albert Heijn at Museumplein to be more well-stocked than the smaller one near the hotel, so we started shopping there, and we were able to transport our groceries easily on the back rack of the bike. I highly recommend everyone rent a bike. Overall, a great experience. If you are the type of traveller who wants to see the major sites but also wants to get a sense of the city outside of those sites, this hotel is a great place to be based.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet palce to stay in a vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: lumponmyhead
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a stones throw from the Western end of the Vondelpark. If you are arriving at central station get on the No 2 Tram to take you there, this will save you 25 Euros in a taxi. The hotel is in a quiet residential upmarket street and is near lots of restaurants, a couple of coffee shops, and a supermarket. The rooms are small, but not mean. The bathrooms are more or less an en suite but well styled and clean. I had one of the best nights sleep I've had in a hotel here, the bed comfy and there was no noise either from the other rooms or from the street. The staff are very efficient, you can buy tickets for the museums here and the advice the staff gave us on how to get around the city very useful. Vondelpark is an amazingly peaceful place, if you made a loud noise in this area you'd stick out a mile. I would say this hotel suits couples more than families, although my family were very happy here. Apart from the TV there was nothing here to amuse kids, so if your kids need amusement, you'll be doing it. My kids made their own amusement buy treating the beds as a trampoline and recieved a phone call asking them, very politely, to stop and be a bit quieter. Nothing more was said, though, very well dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mcdan_19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after getting a ceap deal on thomascook online! Didn't know what to expect but when we arrived we were very pleased! Set in a lovely area next to the stunning vondelpark and just a 10 min tram ride into town! The rooms are small but great, homely, cosy, warm (it was minus six and snowing) and really clean! Reception are very helpful and breakfast was brill! Everything you needed to start a fun packed day of walking around sightseeing! Would definetly stay again we had an amazing time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gail154
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here and although it was slightly off the beaten track it was a perfect base. The hotel was just what we were looking for and the staff were friendly from the start and very helpful. We arrived in Amsterdam early and made our way to the hotel to drop off our bags when we checked in the hotel the rooms were ready for us which was fantastic. The rooms are small but comfortable and the beds were heaven. Breakfast was just right to start the day with and plenty of selection to choose from. Would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: anonymous186337
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet residential area at the back of Vondelpark. The rooms are average size for Amsterdam and are quite cosy but very clean and the towels were replaced daily. Without doubt the best nights sleep I've experienced in an Amsterdam hotel. The staff were all very helpful, even offering us coffee when we arrived early before the official check in times. Amstelveensweg is just round the corner and provides a number of restaurants and bars with food from all over the world and there is also an Albert Heijn supermarket closeby. If you are after the Amsterdam nightlife, then this hotel is probably too far out from Leidseplein but it does provide a perfect base for a very relaxing holiday within a hundred yards of Vondelpark. For the price we paid, the hotel cannot be faulted and we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY”
Reviews.Author: BBunni
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay here with my boyfriend in february 2012 for my 25th birthday. It is in a lovely safe location and the transport links are good. Tram 2 takes you in and out out of city centre in 20mins. Get off at stop Amstelveenseweg and the hotel is 5 mins from the tram stop. Check in and out was simple and speedy. We paid the city tax when we checked in (5euros) and were given a gorgeous room with double bed as requested, it was on the 3rd floor and there is a lift for convenience. The room was compact, modern, clean, well kept and the bed was soo comfy and bouncy. The bathroom was lovely as well, compleley tiled floor to ceiling in modern beige with nice fittings and clean with a fab double shower with perfect water pressure. We left a sign on the door to not be disturbed by the maid which we were not but she left fresh linen outside the door for us which was much appreciated.The room was a perfect size for two,we didnt spend much time there but if we had we still would have been happy with the size. There is a flat screen t.v. with a few english channels and also a travel kettle with a few bits and bobs for hot drinks on a tray. When I asked for an extra pillow for my boyfriend it was given to me promptly at reception. When there was a problem with the room card not letting us in, again this was dealt with quickly without fuss. I do not have a single complaint about the service here and appreciated the laid back but efficient style. We did not have the breakfast so cannot comment. Overall a fantastic stay and I will definatley be booking again. Dont stay here if you want to be really close to the action but if like myself you dont mind a short trip into the centre everyday I would say go for it because it is great value for money and a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and small hotel in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: Bartho0
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a nice quiet residential area near the Vondelpark. Nearby are some restaurants. In 5-8 minutes walk to tram line 1 or 2, which take you in15 minutes to the city center. The room is well furnished and clean, however, very small! But good to sleep. The breakfast room is also small, but the quality and quantity of the breakfast is fine. A good hotel to stay in Amsterdam, you're probably better of here than an expensive hotel in the center

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, quiet area”
Reviews.Author: sophie37212
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two night, It was a little far out but it very near the tram is just around the corner. Very safe area, lovely hotel, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice area but a little out of centre”
Reviews.Author: Joanne R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days here. It is a little out of way but having figured out how to get around using tram we did not find this a problem. The tram system is very good we bought a 3 day ticket and trams are every 10 mins and only a short walk from hotel. The hotel was very clean, in a good area, only negative was rooms a bit small and at 10 euro each for breakfast we passed finding it too expensive, however there are a few nice coffee shops close by in which we could get a nice bagel for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, compact, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mcnearwalker
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel Central Park. Once we worked out the trams from central station with the assistance of google maps we found the trams a great form of transport at â‚¬7 for a 24 hour ticket. The hotel was very clean, in a posh area, which made us feel very safe to walk late at night. Staff were very friendly. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, lovely quiet location, excellent transport links”
Reviews.Author: rangoon34
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for weekend. We arrived at 9am happy to put our bags in the luggage room, but to our surprise the receptionist let us go straight to our room for no additional cost. The room was just as described in the Trip Adviser reviews I had read. Compact, very clean, and as long as you use the floor towel outside the wetroom you can easily keep the tiny bathroom floor dry. The number 2 tram stops right by the hotel, which gives easy access to all areas of the city. The hotel is next door to the Vondelpark, which is lovely to walk through. The whole area feels upmarket, safe and extremely quiet. My only advice would be to get to breakfast well before 10am. Was a bit disappointing that some items were no longer available. The room felt chilly when we got back at night and we were never able to get the heating working. To be fair, if we'd actually asked I'm sure they would've sorted it out, but we were just too tired to make the descent to the ground floor. So I just put my hairdryer on to heat the room, which didn't take long as the room is so small. Will definately stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a good location. Great if on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: jennyrob669
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for two nights in October 2011. The hotel is 20 euros in a taxi from central station. You can walk through Vondel park to the city center, takes about 20 minutes. The hotel was basic. Had a double bed and a small bathroom with a toilet and shower. There was a T.V available and wi-fi in the hotel is free. Receptionist was lovely, she gave us a guide to Amsterdam and told us how the trams work (cheapest easiest way to get around Amsterdam). Only let down was there is a building being renovated opposite the hotel, so if you're travelling there soon I believe the work will still be going on. I will add pictures. The building work started about 8am and was very loud! Since we were only there for 2 nights we could live with it! Breakfast was only small continental, but was very tasty. I enjoyed my stay here and would use this hotel again when next travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kamelia60
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. Extremely easy to get to from the city centre and central train station by tram number 2. Great location away from the busy canals, but still less than 10min tram ride. The rooms are quite small, but clean and comfortable. Good value (for Amsterdam). The park and surrounding areas are also extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome: centre, clean, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: OlenaOlena
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and tidy, the rooms are fresh renovated and have new furniture. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is next to the beautiful park, almost in the centre of Amsterdam. The city center is reachable within 5 minutes by tram or walk through the park. The area where the hotel is located is very nice and quiet. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dynamite155
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in a really nice location. Its a tram ride from the center, but there are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. Our room overlooked Vondel Park and we had a belcony also. The room was really clean and the bathroom was very modern and well lite. The bed was one of the most comfortable i have slept in. The breakfast is not worth the price you pay for it. Its in a small roomswith not much to see. The service was ok but we had to wait around on a couple of ocassions.

Reviews.Title: “A highly recommended and friendly home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: travellingGabriel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Central Park as a solo traveller, and can honestly say that it was one of the friendliest hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff were wonderful, and really looked after the guests. The room was lovely, simple and clean, with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was of an adequate size for me, and it too was clean and sparkling. I didn't try the breakfast as I am not really a breakfast person, so I can't comment on that. Considering some of the other reviewers complained about the location, it's actually not that far out, and Amsterdam's public transport system is exemplary - the tram that goes to the hotel stops right by the Van Gogh museum, Rijksmuseum, the Flower Market and Dam Square so it's pretty well connected. The hotel is in a lovely and quiet residential area with lots of nice restaurants nearby (there's a particularly lovely chilled out outdoor place to eat right by the entrance to the Vondelpark). I'm so pleased I stayed at the Hotel Central Park, and would have no hesitations in staying there again or recommending it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Lisicella
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience at Hotel Central Park. The rooms were clean, modern and air-conditioned. Yes, it is a little out of the way, but you can walk through Vondelpark to the Centrum of Amsterdam, and it's a gorgeous stroll. We also rented bikes on our second day (which you can do at the hotel, very handy) and enjoyed biking through the park and around the city. If you'd like a terrace, request room 307 -- I think it might be the only room with a balcony. However, this room is currently right next to a demolition project, so I'd give it a few months! On a last note, the staff were incredibly helpful. Thanks to everyone at Hotel Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Amsterdam Inn with comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: MiaPoppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Central Park while visiting our daughter and her family who live in the neighborhood. What a warm and friendly welcome we received from Matt upon our arrival. We are returning today for a few more nights and expect the same friendly and cozy experience. The rooms are small, but very neat and clean. The breakfast has virtually anything you might want with the exception of a cook. Juices, breads, meats, fruit, cereals and more. If you are traveling from the US you need to adjust your expectations for size, but be pleasantly surprised by the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff (especially Matt)

Reviews.Title: “I didn't expect it to be so good”
Reviews.Author: Filip82
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the best! You get big breakfast in the morning and you never leave hungry. The rooms are clean and everyday housekeeper cleans it up. To sum it up I would say the hotel is the best it can be. It is a bit away from town but if you are going to Amsterdam for the first time it will make you do alot of extra sight seeing. It's 30-40mins walk to centre, 5mins with tram that costs 2,60euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: normangorman
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Located quite a distance from the town centre, however No. 2 tram is nearby & a single journey is just 2.60. Toilet was a wet room & a bit small but served its purpose. Room was adequate & breakfast was European style (as you'd expect) Probably wouldn't stay there again because it's too far from the city centre but as a last minute booking I was just pleased to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE, CLEAN AND MODERN ROOM BUT VERY SMALL”
Reviews.Author: DazNGez
Reviews.Content: We had a double room, very comfortable beds but very small. Its located out of town (10min bike ride, 30min walk), but is located at the edge of Vondelpark which is a great spot if you dont want to stay in the centre of activity. Great neighbourhood, quiet and safe. Would recommend staying here and getting a bicycle to explore the city, staff speak great English and are helpful, breakfast not included but only 7.50â‚¬ extra and is pretty decent. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So far away from the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: jodelicious
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cleas, with a wetroom for a bathroom. The internet site we booked with siad it was a central location. it is not. it is a 20 min tram ride, thats when you have figured out the tram. we arrived late at night and even the cab driver had no idea where it was. we spent an hour walking around the residential area that it is in, trying to find it. when returning from town a second night, the other cab driver had no idea either! it is nice, but stay nearer town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, modern but quite a bit outside city centre”
Reviews.Author: ireland8282
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in March this year for 3 nights. Advertised on website as walking distance to city centre, which is not entirely true. Estimated 50 minutes walk to city centre although trams run from stop near hotel every few minutes, costing 2.60 euro each way, which all adds up... On the plus side, very clean, very comfortable, modern hotel. quiet location. Recommend it if you dont mind the trek.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Central Park
HotelInfo.Address: Waldeck Pyrmontlaan 9, Amsterdam 1075 BT, The Netherlands
